verse: स वै नैव रेमे तस्मादेकाकी न रमते स द्वितीयमैच्छत्। स हैतावानास यथा स्त्रीपुमासौ सम्परिष्वक्तौ। स इममेवात्मानं द्वेधाऽपातयत्ततः पतिश्च पत्नी चाभवतां तस्मादिदमर्धबृगलमिव स्व इति ह स्माह याज्ञवल्क्यस्तस्मादयमाकाशः स्त्रिया पूर्यत एव ता समभवत्ततो मनुष्या अजायन्त॥
meaning: He indeed does not find pleasure alone, therefore desires a second. He embraced these two, female and male, like embracing each other. He divided his own self into two halves, then the husband and wife came into being. Therefore, Yajnavalkya said, "This is like half of a sphere, this is my own" (referring to the husband's part). Therefore, this space is filled by the woman. Thus, through this balance, humans were born.
